value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">saw the present moment in all its crudity. He</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>saw the</del> was no antiquary. <del>He knew what he</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He <del>had his</del> His eyes were open as he rode from</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">town to town to what was actually in existence.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He saw poverty; he saw the peasant <del>suff</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">unable to buy a grave. He saw the nobles</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[eye?] long the field. He saw the great man lying</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.] to in bed, after his [hawking?] & his hunting, in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">poor made waiting hour after hour to bring his</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">care upon him. He saw the great ladies</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">wearing vardigalls & puffing their hair out in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tussocks. And what he saw in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">roads, in the fields, in the house, he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">described in a voice that stumbles & stutters &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">cannot keep to the theme; for he is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">enraged by what he sees. This was the voice of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the new <del>learning</del>. As he walked in the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-arch" key="Archbishop of Canterbury">
            <choice>
              <sic>A of C.</sic>
              <corr>Archbishop of Canterbury's</corr>
            </choice></rs> garden, <quote source="#" rend="inline">looking in my [bokes?] –</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"I cannot go long [bokes?], for poor folks</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">come unto me, desiring <del>tha</del> me that I will</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">[illeg.] so that their matters may be heard</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If he tries to send in the 
            <choice>
              <sic>A of C</sic>
              <corr>Archbishop of Canterbury's</corr>
            </choice> garden,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the poor come knocking at the gate, & his man</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">says <quote source="#" rend="inline">"Lo there is someone at the gate 
            <choice>
              <sic>wd</sic>
              <corr>would</corr>
            </choice></quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">speak with you..."</quote> and so</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">faithfully, <del>[outpoured?]</del> not [illeg.] he 
            <choice>
              <sic>wd</sic>
              <corr>would</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he brings before the young king the state of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">England at the very moment.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">To him <del>the old Engand is</del> <del>no less</del> It is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">preacher who [exacts?] the <del>farmers</del> farmers; <del>the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for <del>he fain</del> upon them the light of the new</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">knowledge. He <del>alone</del> knows what he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is saying for he too, until he was thirty</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"walked in the shadow of death"</quote></l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l>He too had, <del>taken</del> <add>[illeg.]</add> part in the old</l>
            <l>superstitions.     But since       <del>But</del></l>
          </del>
